mapper.update: update order_information set o_type = #{oType,jdbcType=INTEGER}, contacts = #{contacts,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, start_date = #{startDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, end_date = #{endDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, price = #{price,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, shipping_address = #{shippingAddress,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, receiving_address = #{receivingAddress,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, s_id = #{sId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, d_id = #{dId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, o_state = #{oState,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, e_id = #{eId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, o_remarks = #{oRemarks,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where o_id = #{oId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: select o_id, o_type, contacts, start_date, end_date, price, shipping_address, receiving_address, s_id, d_id, o_state, e_id, o_remarks from order_information where o_id = #{oId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
select o_id, o_type, contacts, start_date, end_date, price, shipping_address, receiving_address, s_id, d_id, o_state, e_id, o_remarks from order_information

select * from order_information
o_state like concat('%',#{oState},'%')
and contacts like concat('%',#{contacts},'%')
and o_id like concat('%',#{oId},'%')

select count(*) from order_information
o_state like concat('%',#{oState},'%')
and contacts like concat('%',#{contacts},'%')
and o_id like concat('%',#{oId},'%')

select count(*) from order_information where o_state like concat('%', #{type}, '%')
and s_id = sId
and d_id = dId
